âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI agent framework for black-box security testing â€¢ Supports bug bounty, red-team, and penetration testing workflows â€¢ Configurable with OpenAI, Anthropic, or LiteLLM-supported providers â€¢ Offers TUI, Docker, and command-line interfaces â€¢ Includes pre-built attack playbooks
ðŸ“– Summary: PentestAgent is an AI-powered framework designed for automated black-box security testing. It supports various penetration testing workflows, including bug bounty hunting and red-teaming, by leveraging AI agents to interact with systems and identify vulnerabilities.

âœ¨ trafexia | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Intercepting and analyzing HTTP/HTTPS traffic from mobile devices for debugging and development purposes.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ MITM Proxy Server â€¢ Auto CA Certificate Generation â€¢ QR Code Setup â€¢ Real-time Request Capture â€¢ Advanced Filtering
ðŸ“– Summary: Trafexia is a desktop application built with Electron, Vue 3, and TypeScript that functions as a MITM proxy server. It allows users to intercept, analyze, and debug HTTP/HTTPS traffic from mobile devices, offering features like auto CA certificate generation, real-time capture, advanced filtering, and various export options.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ neohtop | Svelte
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Desktop system monitoring and process management
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time process monitoring â€¢ CPU and Memory usage tracking â€¢ Advanced process search and filtering with regex support â€¢ Process management (kill processes) â€¢ Sort by any column
ðŸ“– Summary: NeoHtop is a modern, cross-platform system monitoring application built with Rust, Tauri, and Svelte. It provides real-time insights into CPU, memory usage, and running processes, offering advanced features like process search, filtering, and management.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ open-oasis | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Generating interactive gameplay frames using the Oasis 500M world model.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Inference script for Oasis 500M model â€¢ Action-conditional frame generation â€¢ Autoregressive gameplay generation â€¢ Conditioning on user keyboard input â€¢ Loads prompt frames from videos
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides Python inference code for the Oasis 500M model, an interactive world model based on diffusion transformers. It allows users to generate gameplay frames autoregressively, conditioned on user keyboard input and a prompt frame from a video.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ AutoRLAIF | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To automate and enhance the fine-tuning of large language models using Reinforcement Learning from AI Feedback, making the process more efficient and performant.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automated Fine-Tuning using RLAIF â€¢ High-Efficiency Training with QLoRA and PEFT â€¢ Integration of multiple datasets (human preference, chatbot conversations, AI-generated pairs) â€¢ Advanced Training Techniques (LoRA, EMA, R-Drop)
ðŸ“– Summary: AutoRLAIF is a Python framework that automates the fine-tuning of large language models using Reinforcement Learning from AI Feedback (RLAIF). It leverages techniques like QLoRA and PEFT for efficient training and integrates multiple datasets to improve model performance with minimal human supervision.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
